(a) List six adjustments that are shown in the final accounts.
(b) State three differences between capital expenditure and revenue expenditure.
correct_answer:
(a) Adjustments in the final accounts
i. Rent in arrears or in advance.
ii. Salaries in arrears or in advance.
iii. Provision for bad or doubtful debts.
iv. Depreciation of non-current assets.
v. Goods taken by owners.
vi. Income in arrears or in advance.
vii. Provision for discount on doubtful debts.
(b) Difference between capital expenditure and recurrent expenditure.i. Capital expenditure occurs once a year while recurrent occurs every year. E.g construction of building occur once while salaries of staff occur every year.ii. Capital expenditure usually involves huge financial commitment while recurrent expenditure does not involve huge financial commitment.iii. Capital expenditure leads to acquisition of assets which have long lifespan while recurrent expenditure is consumed once and for all.

text:
Ose, a sole proprietor, does not keep proper books of account.  
(a) Identify and explain the system of bookkeeping Ose operates.  
(b) State three advantages and three disadvantages of the bookkeeping system Ose operates.
correct_answer:
(a)Ose is operating a single-entry system of accounting.
A single-entry system of accounting involves not recording the transaction with double entry system. It means that there are no ledger accounts nor a balance sheet.
(b)Advantages of single entryi. It is cheap since you will not need to employ an accountant to do the double entry system.ii. It is easy to understand for a layman.iii. It is easy for reviewing and minimal error.
Disadvantage of single entryi. It cannot be used for formal purpose such as application for grants and loans.ii. It does not show whether the business is making profit or lossiii. It does not reveal the true financial position of the business.
